Static Public Member Functions

Alaris.Irc.Identd Class Reference

An Ident daemon is still used by some IRC networks for authentication. It is a simple service which when queried by a remote system returns a username. The server is controlled via static methods all of which are Thread safe. More...

List of all members.

Static Public Member Functions

static void Start (string userName)
 The Identd server will start listening for queries in its own thread. It can be stopped by calling Identd.Stop.
static bool IsRunning ()
 Check if the Identd server is running.
static void Stop ()
 Stop the Identd server and close the thread.

Detailed Description

An Ident daemon is still used by some IRC networks for authentication. It is a simple service which when queried by a remote system returns a username. The server is controlled via static methods all of which are Thread safe.

Member Function Documentation

static bool Alaris.Irc.Identd.IsRunning (  )  [static]

Check if the Identd server is running.

Returns:
True if it is running
static void Alaris.Irc.Identd.Start ( string  userName  )  [static]

The Identd server will start listening for queries in its own thread. It can be stopped by calling Identd.Stop.

Parameters:
userName Should be the same username as the one used in the ConnectionArgs object when establishing a connection.
Exceptions:
Exception If the server has already been started.
static void Alaris.Irc.Identd.Stop (  )  [static]

Stop the Identd server and close the thread.
